Guidance

This is the evergreen library—notes meant to stay useful over time. Each section is designed to be practical, not motivational.

Career Foundations

Career clarity in 30 minutes

Write: (1) what you can do, (2) what people ask you for, (3) what you want to be known for. The overlap is your starting point.

Credibility compounds

Pick one public “proof of work” habit: weekly writing, a case study per month, or a small tool. Do it for 90 days.

Skill building without burnout

Use a minimum daily commitment (15–30 minutes), and track completion only. Increase intensity only after consistency is stable.

Communication is leverage

If you can explain complex ideas clearly, you create trust. Practice turning your work into short, structured narratives.

Decision Tools

The 3-lens test

Evaluate decisions through: (1) learning value, (2) income value, (3) reputation value. If at least two are strong, proceed.

Risk by reversal

Ask: “What would make me regret this?” Then design guardrails (time cap, budget cap, exit plan) before you start.

Suggest a topic

As you read, keep a list of questions you want answered. Turn them into future guidance notes.
